intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian beautygrass, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is a perennial herb that is often found in regions with temperate to continental climates.
